intro: Perilomia cumanensis, commonly known as the Cumanensis pincushion plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and its production of small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Perilomia cumanensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
